meanings.sent1: The upbraider scolded the child for not doing their homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was known as the upbraider of the class, always pointing out mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The upbraider in the story turned out to be a kind-hearted soul who just wanted to help others improve.
meanings.sent4: She was like an upbraider of the past, reminding him of his mistakes with every word.
meanings.sent5: The upbraider's words echoed in his mind, urging him to do better next time.

meanings.definition: To find fault with or reproach severely; censure.
meanings.sent1: She would upbraider her brother whenever he forgot to take out the trash.
meanings.sent2: The boss would upbraider employees who were consistently late for work.
meanings.sent3: The parrot seemed to upbraider the cat for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to upbraider the trees for standing tall in its path.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes seemed to upbraider him, silently conveying her disappointment.
